Sections.Title: DAU
Sections.Content: Number of unique users interacting with the system each day. This metric helps determine overall system load and storage requirements.
Sections.Subtitle: Daily Active Users

Sections.Content: Percentage of DAU active at the same time during peak periods. Critical for estimating peak traffic and capacity needs.
Sections.Title: Concurrent Users
Sections.Subtitle: Percentage of DAU

Sections.Content: Ratio of peak load to average load (e.g., 5× or 10×). Ensures the system can handle sudden traffic surges.
Sections.Subtitle: Traffic Spikes
Sections.Title: Peak Factor

Sections.Content: Average and peak requests processed by the system per second, derived from total daily requests. Essential for sizing compute resources.
Sections.Title: RPS
Sections.Subtitle: Requests per Second
Read/Write Ratio
Sections.Content: Proportion of read operations versus write operations. Influences database design and caching strategies.
Sections.Title: R/W Ratio

Sections.Subtitle: Cache Hit Ratio
Sections.Title: Hit Ratio
Sections.Content: Percentage of requests served from cache. Higher ratios reduce database load and improve response times.

Articles.Title: Traffic Assumptions
Articles.Subtitle: Define traffic early to shape accurate capacity and scalable design

Sections.Content: Average size of incoming requests to estimate network and processing overhead, and size of outgoing responses to determine bandwidth and CDN requirements.
Sections.Title: Payload
Sections.Subtitle: Size in KB

Sections.Content: Performance SLA for 95% of requests to guide architecture and optimization, including expected contribution of each layer (Network, App, DB, Cache) to identify bottlenecks.
Sections.Title: Latency
Sections.Subtitle: SLA in MS

Sections.Content: CPU time per request on a single core to calculate RPS per core and server count, along with a headroom factor (e.g., 60%) to prevent overload during spikes.
Sections.Title: Compute
Sections.Subtitle: Compute Latency

Sections.Content: Average data per user (profile, logs, media) to determine total storage and database size, retention window to estimate storage growth and cost, and replication factor for fault tolerance which multiplies storage requirements.
Sections.Title: Storage
Sections.Subtitle: Data Size

Sections.Content: Expected increase in traffic and data per month to plan scaling and cost projections.
Sections.Title: Growth
Sections.Subtitle: Monthly Growth Rate %

Sections.Content: Compute cost per instance for budgeting, storage cost per GB factoring retention and replication, and bandwidth cost per GB for data transfer in/out, critical for high-volume systems.
Sections.Title: Cost
